elements.2211.03270_e4234d736c383e831632ca1e45979: Incorporating large-scale pre-trained models with the prototypical neural networks is a
elements.2211.03270_ab5d601ac5acaa8ee4cf23ff4cfd9: paradigm in few-shot named entity recognition
elements.2211.03270_9ed3b6df057750f60f1752e7ea612: Existing methods, unfortunately, are not aware of the fact that embeddings from pre-trained models contain a prominently large amount of information regarding word
elements.2211.03270_c774ab369089bff4b3d7eef201cd4: , biasing prototypical neural networks against learning word
elements.2211.03270_349d1fc8ccdeed24adb094fe6b4cf: This discrepancy constrains the two models' synergy
elements.2211.03270_074a6287e212989290831ede2b2c8: Thus, we propose a one-line-code normalization method to reconcile such a mismatch with empirical and theoretical grounds
elements.2211.03270_02e16deacb876f85c27cf6393df61: Our experiments based on nine benchmark datasets show the superiority of our method over the counterpart models and are comparable to the state-of-the-art methods
elements.2211.03270_171e6ccb4c5b0fbbedd699f9592c5: In addition to the model enhancement, our work also provides an analytical viewpoint for addressing the general problems in few-shot name entity recognition or other tasks that rely on pre-trained models or prototypical neural networks.
elements.2211.03270_a8d779bfb7c1f7864ac25e226f2e8: Named entity recognition (NER) is a classical task in natural language processing (NLP) which aims to automatically identify entities in the plain text by classifying each word to a set of pre-defined entities,
elements.2211.03270_7352f5ff2863d2bb435ffa15e793b: As a crucial sub-component of many language understanding tasks, NER has been widely adopted to different applications,
elements.2211.03270_c87bf15c9346d4984527735626052: Neural networks (NNs) have achieved great success in NER
elements.2211.03270_f99ea5d8594aa56eb7b0107687174: However, NNs face the adaptation challenge
elements.2211.03270_74f3bf9b154610fd83ac82460786b: as words in different entities can change to a great extent
elements.2211.03270_00a4808a86d0aaf8fa5733ed63567: "budgets" in the "money", and obtaining sufficient annotations of new entities can be expensive
elements.2211.03270_a282bbe35845671ea461295da0653: Few-shot NER, a cost-efficient solution, aims at training a model to be aware of unseen entities given few labeled examples
elements.2211.03270_9d5d5b32de78ee557a3d9d5496a2c: Few-shot NER has received a rising interest in the NLP community, where new datasets
elements.2211.03270_21746938a0641e3fd66852102e0e9: Low-dim manifold encodes more adaptive information
elements.2211.03270_adf5c06b14080736752ae033ef34f: learn an embedding space where the same-entity datapoints are clustered around a center, called the prototype, and distances between the query data to all prototypes represent its entity probabilities
elements.2211.03270_bcf1ac22b26d4b5977da1a7282f6c: In addition to using an embedding network, PNNs calculate the prototypes and distances
elements.2211.03270_2eb9eb5885a89e3ad58c4e5fc84b1: algorithm, gaining popularity for the flexibility and low computing cost
elements.2211.03270_21bc5233cf1ec4a421163cd8f9587: A supplementary enhancement will be using embeddings from large-scale pre-trained models (PTMs), like BERT
elements.2211.03270_0d96ea05b24ec5a1199764020c390: , to provide extra knowledge that helps PNNs' learning of entities
elements.2211.03270_0b79432a4b13290042f36da858a8b: As such, incorporating PTMs with PNNs has become a de-facto paradigm for few-shot NER that achieves competitive results to state-of-the-arts
elements.2211.03270_cd8895c582088e234f68f4991376e: to enhance the model, but they tend not to examine the coordinating effects between PTMs and PNNs in terms of the information contained in embeddings
elements.2211.03270_2b3dcbc920365124227c9d28b286b: It should be reminded that PNNs calculate distances between word embeddings and prototypes to represent entity probabilities
elements.2211.03270_28f35ace9c7a57c55e85941c6edbe: However, PTMs embeddings may not effectively provide entity information as they prominently contain information on word frequencies
elements.2211.03270_9a6f92ae5a56077d1188611aa7484: , and we find frequencies are shallow statistics that can cause a loss of in-depth and useful entity-denoting information
elements.2211.03270_658d2b2548f7d5f61072b14d373ae: By probing into PNNs, we find that words tend to be classified to the entity centred with words of higher frequencies
elements.2211.03270_fdc17a9ee7dd696666a24ca825153: Therefore, the distance measure is biased towards focusing on frequencies
elements.2211.03270_e83464af33732e1edfc3af38b9e19: Such a bias can cause the over-fitting of the PNNs and the unreliability on classifying new entities
elements.2211.03270_143fc345926b20f8b5485648570c8: As a consequence, when frequencies are changed on a new corpus, the distances can no longer effectively represent the entity probabilities
elements.2211.03270_270d6dcf2e06d692fae65f69cc0ee: Form a mathematical view, the biased distance is mainly caused by the varying prototype
elements.2211.03270_17004158c02275892c653e5c91d8b: -norms contribute little to but actually undermine the correct classification
elements.2211.03270_5d04b69f8de8d1e1df8122c5aac14: We propose to normalize all prototypes to unit vectors as a simple yet effective remedy to reconcile PNNs and PTMs for few-shot NER
elements.2211.03270_3c321d45e05dc0e994988939453bd: Our experiments on nine few-shot NER datasets
elements.2211.03270_8fc1bc0ba7b48f85d19ec3e69df0f: demonstrate the effectiveness of our one-line-code remedy
elements.2211.03270_1330de65ca231143ab89b722ceae1: The normalized PNNs achieve competitive results compared to the state-of-the-art methods while retaining all the PNNs' advantages, such as easy implementation and low computation cost
elements.2211.03270_1d2db19f0f5741ee3eb4c82efac48: We also demonstrate normalization can make PNNs learn more effectively about correctly classifying entities, and conduct ablation studies on different normalization strategies
elements.2211.03270_02eeea61ab5b490d0587b5026a085: Our study on reconciling PTMs and PNNs, and the promising performance of the simple normalization method may inspire new research motivations to the few-shot NER, as well as other fields that involve the use of PTMs /or PNNs.
elements.2211.03270_469997616d80e3093ed42afe852b2: Named entity recognition can be formalized as the word classification (Figure
elements.2211.03270_2959dc66ccfe77cac255a61adae5f: -shot" describes the task setting: after the training, the model needs to classify the query data to
elements.2211.03270_a5bcb81378adbaa2089275d8a4ae8: The core issue in FSC is the unreliable empirical loss minimization: as the labeled data is extremely limited during testing, the loss defined on new classes will result in a sub-optimal solution that may lead to undesired performance
elements.2211.03270_91c02ab723bfe41711c2df7d24219: To tackle this issue, researchers seek solutions with the embedding-based methods
elements.2211.03270_1cfa2fc32615a904923d66bb37c77: Specifically, an embedding network projects datapoints to a low-dim manifold that contains some general features shared among training and testing classes
elements.2211.03270_6c8394a87cb0c6fc8a216d17ad1b3: On the embedding space, to train only a small classifier for new classes consumes fewer data and can achieve equivalently good results
elements.2211.03270_f4bc730ab05e8027cc79eb3ec6651: The recent embedding-based classifiers with meta-learning
elements.2211.03270_c1024e7224a9979e433d4c73492cc: divides the training data into several "episodes" mimicking the "
elements.2211.03270_949165bfc42065a978c6b0d75c9e0: Such a method is popularly known for its effectiveness in FSC.
elements.2211.03270_8e565e9cdecda6e36f2b4a6056a70: assume in the embedding space, the same-class datapoints are clustered around class centers, called the prototypes, and the distances between datapoints to prototypes represent their class probabilities
elements.2211.03270_411d81031570ac8c54f9267891fc5: Based on this assumption, PNNs need only calculate: 1) the prototypes using the embedded labeled data, and 2) the distances between the embedded query data and prototypes to conduct the classification
elements.2211.03270_27efba375262fab0f9fe8692dce6e: The detailed discussions about PNNs will be presented in section
elements.2211.03270_bfe057aeace8fdb66323626b0f7bf: Utilizing large-scale PTMs as the embedding networks, PNNs can achieve competitive results in various natural language FSC tasks
elements.2211.03270_4cd4dafa3cde008e7c99e13eb5278: In NER, recent works consider a bunch of methods to enhance the coordinating usage of PTMs and PNNs, including in-domain pre-training
elements.2211.03270_3452f5c353ec82776dd635605ba91: However, to best of our knowledge, little has been explored for the correct combination of PTMs and PNNs
elements.2211.03270_957286007d180a8f9d1e013603129: There have been works that find both the small-scale
elements.2211.03270_bb95f88a40e8744214ed16d7bed73: PTMs have limitations in representing diverse language semantics
elements.2211.03270_03957a71a1922720b8f860072c06e: Such limitations may prevent PNNs from correctly adopting entity information, reducing the possibility of getting optimal results.

elements.2211.03270_375e74c5c6f6736cfe16d110b6843: Humans are prone to processing high-frequency words as reported in psychological studies
elements.2211.03270_f8dd72d3dc86183b444b83f5d1d13: Applying this psychological finding to the named entity recognition in natural language processing, we postulate that if a word appears more frequently, its entity should be easier to be classified
elements.2211.03270_63c79262a519b2a8935f1092cf6ae: To this end, PNNs well adapt to task difficulty through the frequency-related embedding

elements.2211.03270_1bfa2d696c3cde8d5245c7eed6d4b: . "NNShot" classifies the query data to its nearest data entity in the embedding space, and "Struct" further leverages the Viterbi decoding
elements.2211.03270_a1276d8576cdccde0084c28dfec9a: to produce the final results. "CONTaiNER" as well as the Viterbi enhanced version are proposed by
elements.2211.03270_9a222b36a0f097d8c926b0cf83571: It utilizes contrastive learning to differentiate word entities
elements.2211.03270_b034d41ecaa5d84b0be03cb16d3e1: And unlike PNN, "NNShot" and "Struct", "CONTaiNER" will be fine-tuned on the new entities using the limited labeled examples
elements.2211.03270_95f150221ea35d46cfd2c2a375238: We briefly introduce the main characteristic of Few-NERD: it defines entity types from two perspectives called the fine-grained (INTER) and coarse-grained (INTRA)
elements.2211.03270_984f530ab95f7cb91fbcbb428351f: Under the fine-grained definition, different entities can share more abstract similarities
elements.2211.03270_c826742eaba8b3626f8fcb8879b11: For example, entities "Island" and "Mountain" are both "Location", and entities "Director" and "Athlete" are both "Person"
elements.2211.03270_e2b5bc263bafac816817733c8bdde: Under the coarse-grained definition, entities have more differences, such as "Location" v.s. "Person" and "Event" v.s. "Organization"
elements.2211.03270_cbf630f2d94b44136426b00450e1d: If the training classes contain "Island", the model can easily identify the entity "Mountain" at the testing because they share the same "Location" information
elements.2211.03270_f4d3bfd203983254b913912c14a05: Therefore, training on the fine-grained set is less challenging for NER on new testing entities
elements.2211.03270_f406bd13cf5a6f1a87ffe7eb6b64e: reports our normalized PNNs on Few-NERD as well as the results of state-of-the-art models, and the original PNNs for comparisons
elements.2211.03270_7004b9b6c20da0fe69b9ac5d7bed0: Compared with the original PNNs, the normalization achieves at least 8.14
elements.2211.03270_df4c1823340d2c3e6e136fec235f5: The sophisticated contrastive learning-based CONTaiNER outperforms our method in certain settings
elements.2211.03270_5845239292afa028d633f64e84dce: On average, our model is slightly superior (49.84
elements.2211.03270_e3dcb4029b8534951bac85bb4ae88: Besides, CONTaiNER needs to be fine-tuned on the testing data in order to alleviate the differences between training and testing entities, which can account for its superior performance on the coarse-grained (INTRA) set
elements.2211.03270_f827db78bb4629d41a9cd008533fb: It should be noted that our normalization method shows competitive performances yet maintains the PNNs' advantages,
elements.2211.03270_ec5591ebdbd1e14e99ed48260d521: the low computation cost and easy implementation
elements.2211.03270_03b7442322e195ce4e8502e6a4315: In addition, our model achieves the highest average F1 scores (57.52
elements.2211.03270_bdc6217872fd56989b6de491a26fc: )) on the fine-grained (INTER) set, demonstrating its superiority in a more practical setting
elements.2211.03270_ae53cd752cf7b16dec95aef7d7d60: proposes two pre-training techniques called noisy supervised pre-training (NSP) and self-training (ST)
elements.2211.03270_fc5939918e083f166834f35fbdc40: NSP utilizes the large-scale noisy labeled entities on Wikipedia to pre-train the models, while ST utilizes an NER system (teacher model) to label large-scale unlabeled datasets to pre-train the student models
elements.2211.03270_97b86d67702f516d4884faabe4c7c: Both the techniques seek extra supervisions to help the model tackle the challenges of the few-shot classification.
elements.2211.03270_ae9f0b1a26c78aecf6146d6584f5f: chooses two baselines: the linear classification (LC) and PNNs
elements.2211.03270_df49dccb5e8d83663edbfe6249b62: And on ten re-structured few-shot NER datasets, they compare the performances of the two baselines as well as the two baselines plus the two pre-training techniques
elements.2211.03270_ec48d09629f2a81d04a5a95a52070: They report the best performance is achieved by the combination of "LC+NSP+ST"

elements.2211.03270_6f9dce40d38eb34703b53a880fae9: Furthermore, higher performance gains are obtained when incorporating the normalized PNNs with the NSP technique (Proto+NSP +6.48
elements.2211.03270_c5c386b9af607623246d906f77fa5: Our results show that the classical PNNs combined with the simple normalization and NSP can achieve the best results on the eight few-shot NER datasets (the open sources do not provide the ST checkpoints for PNN)
elements.2211.03270_d100afc61b45043a1827bcd591bd3: This finding is innovative compared to the results in

elements.2211.03270_0476f8db0a8814981b6708d7674cb: , we only normalize the prototypes and leave the query data embeddings unchanged
elements.2211.03270_6507c0fdd8a5ebbaa64e4b0f8ce80: We conduct ablation studies about the normalization strategies on Few-NERD as shown in Table
elements.2211.03270_ff0f15c3be9b511e8657cbc64bc03: means we normalize only the query data embeddings and leave the prototypes unchanged, and Proto
elements.2211.03270_ba76b32e84c89e76ecc8f01f37b8f: means we normalize both the prototypes and the query data embeddings
elements.2211.03270_3b19ebe4033121b31d4279577633f: We provide four sub-cases for ablation studies
elements.2211.03270_745a9a1ea331c79dd2ea8a7dad94f: All cases report substantial performance decrease.
elements.2211.03270_2014161b7b46e184d3f77ea398f3a: We examine the synergistic effects of the large-scale PTMs and the classical PNNs in the few-shot NER
elements.2211.03270_3d530fa72b8726ea452828aca5c3e: Our theoretical analysis of PNNs shows that PNNs' distances that represent the query data's entity probabilities are partly priorily determined in terms of the prototype
elements.2211.03270_ad9bac8142125ba1c7202bb6b14b7: However, on the embeddings of the PTMs, we empirically verify that embedding
elements.2211.03270_1bc677ebf1fee4aac171f33db4fcf: -norms contain little entity information, being a type of PTMs' representation degeneration
elements.2211.03270_133057a092b77287e464e2b953965: Furthermore, we show that such representation degeneration makes PNNs' distance biased towards frequencies instead of entity-denoting
elements.2211.03270_681d78929131e58064a21df04019c: This distance bias prevents PNNs from learning useful entity information and causes PNNs to overfit the training corpus and become unreliable on new entities
elements.2211.03270_e40b5b44664f53fde722ccb731c39: Therefore, We propose a one-line-code normalization remedy to reconcile PTMs and PNNs for few-shot NER
elements.2211.03270_6a218f1475db5ade63e43610a7cd7: The experimental results based on nine datasets suggest that the normalized PNNs proposed in this work achieve significant performance improvements over the original PNNs and get competitive results compared with the latest sophisticated methods while maintaining PNNs' all advantages, such as easy implementation and low computation cost
elements.2211.03270_5a33b3e1104860aa7012937353ec7: Considering the promising results and the innovation in normalizing the existing models, our results and analysis may be an interest of reference study for researchers and practitioners working with few-shot NER or other relevant tasks that involve the use of PTMs or PNNs.
elements.2211.03270_6b50aed63e77cf0697d071b558cd1: There are certain limitations in this paper
elements.2211.03270_c61faeebbdf746e8f448ae5cc36ea: While our theoretical analysis about PNNs and the concept of PTMs' representation degeneration are not limited to the few-shot named-entity recognition, our focused problem,
elements.2211.03270_cba604242f31d77b5c6bdc01ae3c6: PNNs' distance is biased towards frequencies, is based on the fact that the greatly varied word frequencies represent limited entity information
elements.2211.03270_8322cf79fc8a881bea97d1a1c22ce: It is possible that in other tasks, the corpus frequencies can represent semantic features, or the frequencies change much less
elements.2211.03270_6a23c5f45a182152dd23241619be0: Our normalization remedy, therefore, cannot be directly applied to those tasks
elements.2211.03270_b147405919eb5673cd2cef6bd67e0: Also, representation degeneration is a crucial intrinsic problem of large-scale PTMs
elements.2211.03270_61abf48ccf0bc72587aac87e94446: frequencies and entity information, is one type of practical issue
elements.2211.03270_6c72dd8efed7a5dbc88b2d493e354: We argue that such intrinsic problems can result in different practical issues affecting other NLP tasks beyond this current work's scope.
elements.2211.03270_135186acad3739ebe7a606038d33e: This work is supported by National Key R
